eyes.nn.resnet package¶

Module contents¶

class eyes.nn.resnet.ResNet(in_channels: int = 3, n_classes: int = 1000, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Implementations of ResNet proposed in Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition

Create a default model

Examples

>>> ResNet.resnet18()
>>> ResNet.resnet34()
>>> ResNet.resnet50()
>>> ResNet.resnet101()
>>> ResNet.resnet152()

Customization

You can easily customize your resnet

Examples

>>> # change activation
>>> ResNet.resnet18(activation = nn.SELU)
>>> # change number of classes (default is 1000 )
>>> ResNet.resnet18(n_classes=100)
>>> # pass a different block
>>> ResNet.resnet18(block=SENetBasicBlock)
>>> # change the initial convolution
>>> model = ResNet.resnet18()
>>> model.encoder.gate.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(3, 64, kernel_size=3)
>>> # store each feature
>>> x = torch.rand((1, 3, 224, 224))
>>> model = ResNet.resnet18()
>>> features = []
>>> x = model.encoder.gate(x)
>>> for block in model.encoder.blocks:
    >>> x = block(x)
    >>> features.append(x)
>>> print([x.shape for x in features])
>>> # [torch.Size([1, 64, 56, 56]), torch.Size([1, 128, 28, 28]), torch.Size([1, 256, 14, 14]), torch.Size([1, 512, 7, 7])]
Parameters

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of channels in the input Image (3 for RGB and 1 for Gray). Defaults to 3.

  • n_classes (int, optional) – Number of classes. Defaults to 1000.

forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

ResNet

class eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetBasicBlock(in_features: int, out_features: int, activation: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = functools.partial(<class 'torch.nn.modules.activation.ReLU'>, inplace=True), downsampling: int = 1, conv: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = <class 'torch.nn.modules.conv.Conv2d'>)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

expansion: int = 1¶

Basic ResNet block composed by two 3x3 convs with residual connection.

The residual connection is showed as a black line

The output of the layer is defined as:

\(x' = F(x) + x\)

Parameters

  • in_features (int) – [description]

  • out_features (int) – [description]

  • activation (nn.Module, optional) – [description]. Defaults to ReLUInPlace.

  • downsampling (int, optional) – [description]. Defaults to 1.

  • conv (nn.Module, optional) – [description]. Defaults to nn.Conv2d.

forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetBasicPreActBlock(in_features: int, out_features: int, activation: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = functools.partial(<class 'torch.nn.modules.activation.ReLU'>, inplace=True), downsampling: int = 1, conv: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = <class 'torch.nn.modules.conv.Conv2d'>, *args, **kwars)¶

Bases: eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetBottleNeckBlock

Pre activation ResNet basic block proposed in Identity Mappings in Deep Residual Networks <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1603.05027.pdf>

Parameters

  • in_features (int) – [description]

  • out_features (int) – [description]

  • activation (nn.Module, optional) – [description]. Defaults to ReLUInPlace.

  • downsampling (int, optional) – [description]. Defaults to 1.

  • conv (nn.Module, optional) – [description]. Defaults to nn.Conv2d.

class eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetBottleNeckBlock(in_features: int, out_features: int, activation: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = functools.partial(<class 'torch.nn.modules.activation.ReLU'>, inplace=True), downsampling: int = 1, conv: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = <class 'torch.nn.modules.conv.Conv2d'>, expansion: int = 4)¶

Bases: eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetBasicBlock

expansion: int = 4¶

ResNet BottleNeck block is composed by three convs layer. The expensive 3x3 conv is computed after a cheap 1x1 conv donwsample the input resulting in less parameters. Later, another conv 1v1 upsample the output to the correct channel size

The residual connection is showed as a black line

Parameters

  • in_features (int) – [description]

  • out_features (int) – [description]

  • activation (nn.Module, optional) – [description]. Defaults to ReLUInPlace.

  • downsampling (int, optional) – [description]. Defaults to 1.

  • conv (nn.Module, optional) – [description]. Defaults to nn.Conv2d.

  • expansion (int, optional) – [description]. Defaults to 4.

class eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetBottleNeckPreActBlock(in_features: int, out_features: int, activation: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = functools.partial(<class 'torch.nn.modules.activation.ReLU'>, inplace=True), downsampling: int = 1, conv: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = <class 'torch.nn.modules.conv.Conv2d'>, expansion: int = 4, *args, **kwars)¶

Bases: eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetBasicBlock

Pre activation ResNet bottleneck block proposed in Identity Mappings in Deep Residual Networks <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1603.05027.pdf>

Parameters

  • in_features (int) – [description]

  • out_features (int) – [description]

  • activation (nn.Module, optional) – [description]. Defaults to ReLUInPlace.

  • downsampling (int, optional) – [description]. Defaults to 1.

  • conv (nn.Module, optional) – [description]. Defaults to nn.Conv2d.

  • expansion (int, optional) – [description]. Defaults to 4.

class eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetEncoder(in_channels: int = 3, blocks_sizes: List[int] = [64, 128, 256, 512], deepths: List[int] = [2, 2, 2, 2], activation: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = functools.partial(<class 'torch.nn.modules.activation.ReLU'>, inplace=True), block: torch.nn.modules.module.Module = <class 'eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetBasicBlock'>, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

ResNet encoder composed by increasing different layers with increasing features.

class eyes.nn.resnet.ResNetShorcut(in_features: int, out_features: int, stride: int = 2)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Shorcut function applied by ResNet to upsample the channel when residual and output features do not match

Parameters

  • in_features (int) – features (channels) of the input

  • out_features (int) – features (channels) of the desidered output

forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class eyes.nn.resnet.ResnetDecoder(in_features: int, n_classes: int)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

This class represents the tail of ResNet. It performs a global pooling and maps the output to the correct class by using a fully connected layer.

forward(x)¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.
